name: C++ Programming Fundamentals
description: Learn the fundamentals of C++ programming from scratch. Understand variables, control structures, functions, arrays, and object-oriented programming to build efficient and reliable programs.
whatYouLearn: Understand the structure and syntax of a C++ program
Work with variables, data types, and operators
Use control structures like loops and conditionals
Understand the basics of object-oriented programming (classes, objects, and constructors)

exercises.title: Hello World in C++
exercises.description: Create your first C++ program that prints 'Hello, World!' to the console. Learn the structure of a basic C++ program.
exercises.theory:
A simple C++ program consists of preprocessor directives, a main() function, and output statements. The main function is the entry point of every C++ program.

Key concepts:
• #include <iostream> is used for input/output operations.
• std::cout prints output to the console.
• Every statement ends with a semicolon (;).
exercises.objective: Write a complete C++ program that prints 'Hello, World!' to the screen.
requirements: Use the main() function as the entry point
Print 'Hello, World!' to the console using cout
hints: Remember to include <iostream> for input/output functions
Use std::cout to print text to the screen
Every statement should end with a semicolon

references.title: C++ Basics - GeeksforGeeks
references.description: Introduction to basic syntax and structure of C++ programs.

exercises.title: C++ Functions and Variables
exercises.description: Learn how to declare and use variables and functions in C++. Create a function that adds two numbers and displays the result.
exercises.objective: Write a C++ program with variables and a user-defined function that adds two numbers and prints the result.
requirements: Declare a function named add() that takes two integers
Return the sum of the two integers
Call the function from main() and display the result
hints: Define the function before main() or use a function prototype
Use cout to display the result
Remember to return an integer from main()
